segments.en: Numbered Discourses 10
10. With Upāli
96. With Kokanada

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ānando rājagahe viharati tapodārāme.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodā tenupasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.
segments.en: Then Ānanda rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.

segments.pli: Tapodāya gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
segments.en: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.

segments.pli: Kokanudopi kho paribbājako rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodā tenupasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṃ.
segments.en: The wanderer Kokanada also rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.

segments.pli: Addasā kho kokanudo paribbājako āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ.
segments.en: He saw Ānanda coming off in the distance
and said to him,
“Who’s here, reverend?”
“I’m a mendicant, reverend.”
“Of which mendicants?”
“Of the ascetics who follow the Sakyan.”

segments.pli: “Puccheyyāma mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ kiñcideva desaṃ, sace āyasmā okāsaṃ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā”ti.
segments.en: “I’d like to ask the venerable about a certain point, if you’d take the time to answer.”
“Ask, reverend. When I’ve heard it I’ll know.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti—evaṃdiṭṭhi bhavan”ti?
segments.en: “Is this your view: ‘The world is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
“That’s not my view, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ pana, bho, ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti—evaṃdiṭṭhi bhavan”ti?
segments.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The world is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
“That’s not my view, reverend.”

segments.pli: “Kiṃ nu kho, bho, antavā loko … pe …
segments.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The world is finite …’ …
‘The world is infinite …’ …
‘The soul and the body are the same thing …’ …
‘The soul and the body are different things …’ …
‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …
‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—evaṃdiṭṭhi bhavan”ti?
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
“That’s not my view, reverend.”

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’”ti.
“Tena hi bhavaṃ na jānāti, na passatī”ti?
segments.en: “Then, sir, do you neither know nor see?”

segments.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, na jānāmi na passāmi.
segments.en: “That’s not so, reverend.
I do know and see.”

segments.pli: “‘Kiṃ nu kho, bho, sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
segments.en: “When asked about all these points, you say that’s not your view.

segments.pli: sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
‘Kiṃ pana, bho, asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
Kiṃ nu kho, bho, antavā loko … pe …
hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññanti—
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti vadesi.
‘Tena hi bhavaṃ na jānāti na passatī’ti, iti puṭṭho samāno:
segments.en: Yet when asked whether you neither know nor see,

segments.pli: ‘na kho ahaṃ, āvuso, na jānāmi na passāmi.
segments.en: you say, ‘That’s not so, reverend.
I do know and see.’

segments.pli: Yathā kathaṃ panāvuso, imassa bhāsitassa attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
segments.en: How then should we see the meaning of this statement?”

segments.pli: “‘Sassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti kho, āvuso, diṭṭhigatametaṃ.
segments.en: “‘The world is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly:’ that’s a misconception.

segments.pli: ‘Asassato loko, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti kho, āvuso, diṭṭhigatametaṃ.
segments.en: ‘The world is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly:’ that’s a misconception.
‘The world is finite …’ …
‘The world is infinite …’ …
‘The soul and the body are the same thing …’ …
‘The soul and the body are different things …’ …
‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …
‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā …
segments.en: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā, idameva saccaṃ moghamaññan’ti kho, āvuso, diṭṭhigatametaṃ.
segments.en: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly:’ that’s a misconception.

segments.pli: Yāvatā, āvuso, diṭṭhi yāvatā diṭṭhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhiadhiṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhipariyuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamuṭṭhānaṃ diṭṭhisamugghāto, tamahaṃ jānāmi tamahaṃ passāmi.
segments.en: I know and see the scope of convictions, the scope of grounds for views, fixation on views, obsession with views, the origin of views, and the uprooting of views.

segments.pli: Tamahaṃ jānanto tamahaṃ passanto kyāhaṃ vakkhāmi:
segments.en: Knowing and seeing thus, why should I say:
‘I neither know nor see?’
I do know and see.”

segments.pli: “Ko nāmo āyasmā, kathañca panāyasmantaṃ sabrahmacārī jānantī”ti?
segments.en: “What is the venerable’s name? And how are you known among your spiritual companions?”
“Reverend, my name is Ānanda.
And that’s how I’m known among my spiritual companions.”

segments.pli: “Mahācariyena vata kira, bho, saddhiṃ mantayamānā na jānimha:
segments.en: “Goodness! I had no idea I was consulting such a great teacher as
Venerable Ānanda!
If I had known who
you were, I wouldn’t have said so much.
May Venerable Ānanda please forgive me.”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Rājagaha…

suttaplex.blurb: The wanderer Kokanada meets Ānanda at the baths and engages him on the topic of the ten metaphysical questions.
